name: Demoraliser- A Living Nightmare 12"
description:
Since their humble beginnings as a DIY band based out of the bleak, industrial corners of England, DEMORALISER have applied a strictly punk rock ethic to their own brand of crushing Metallic Hardcore. 
 
Their early EPs cemented them as one of the most talked about bands on the underground circuit, earning them stage time with the likes of Defeater, Bury Your Dead, All Shall Perish, Terror and many more.
 
Now with a colossal debut album ready to unleash unto the masses, Demoraliser are primed and set to set the Metalcore world alight with the crushing record that is ‘A Living Nightmare’. 
Vocalist James ‘Dex’ Dexter’s venom fuelled barks smother the band’s infectiously catchy, yet relentlessly heavy onslaught. Yet beneath all this is a mature sense of melody.

For fans of Darkest Hour, Terror and Bury Your Dead.
 
Pretender
A Living Nightmare
Checkmate
The House Always Wins
Early Years
Eye To Eye
Mother's Ruin
Reap What You Sow
Blind Sighted
Blood Meridian

name: Dyscarnate - And So It Came To Pass
description:
CURRENTLY SOLD OUT REPRESS IN MARCH!

The sophomore offering from the UK's most powerful Death Metal trio.

Think Misery Index having a punch up with Hate Eternal with Internal Bleeding as the referee. Lethal!


The Weight Of All Things
In The Face Of Armageddon
Cain Enable
A Drone In The Hive
Engraving Ecstasy
The Promethean
Grinding Down The Gears
Rise And Fall
Seizure
Kingdom Of The Blind

The Sussex three piece heralded by the British press as “the best new death metal band in the UK, without question”, have unveiled a new song as well as cover art for their highly anticipated sophomore album ‘And So It Came To Pass’.

“After seeing the work he did for The Black Dahlia Murder, Morbid Angel, and Watain, we decided on Valnoir Mortasonge of Metastazis to handle the cover art and layout”, state the band. “His very individual style absolutely captures the epic, mythological themes which run so inherently through our new material.”

The band recorded the new material once again with Chris Fielding at Foel Studio, Wales, which was then mixed and mastered by Jacob Hansen (Aborted, Xerath) in Denmark.

If ‘Enduring The Massacre’ announced their arrival as a fresh force to be reckoned with on the international death metal scene, then ‘And So It Came To Pass’ will surely cement their reputation as one of the best extreme music acts on the modern circuit.

‘And So It Came To Pass’ will be released early 2012 on Siege Of Amida Records, you can catch the band on tour in the UK with Fleshgod Apocalypse and Bloodshot Dawn on the following dates:


March 2012
Tuesday 6th - Plymouth, White Rabbit
Wednesday 7th - London, Purple Turtle
Thursday 8th - Liverpool, The Masque
Friday 9th - Dublin, The Pint
Saturday 10th - Huddersfield, The Parish
Sunday 11th - Edinburgh, Bannermans
Monday 12th - Hull, The Ringside
Tuesday 13th - Derby, The Old Bell
Wednesday 14th - Cardiff, Bogiez

options.name: Dyscarnate- And So It Came To Pass- Slipcase CD

name: Molotov Solution- Insurrection
description:
1. Sin & Sacrifice
2. Injustice For All
3. The Final Hour
4. The Blood Of Tyrants
5. Divide And Conquer
6. Insurrection
7. Cruor Viaticus
8. Prophetic Illusions
9. Collapse
10. Signals
11. Rise

US metal Titans Molotov Solution are fast rising in the States and the wave is about to hit Europe.

Conquering every show they lay waste to, they have developed into a monster of a live act and will be hitting European shores in February for the Bonecrusher tour.

Following a license deal with US label Blk Heart Group, SOAR are proud to reprsent Molotov Solution for their European campaign.

“An insurrection is basically the taking down of a top figure like a king.   If there is a main message to the album, it’s that people should educate themselves and take control of the problems we have as a society rather than waiting on a government to do what’s right.”  Robbie Pina, guitarist of Molotov Solution speaks on the inspiration behind their fourth full-length album Insurrection which was produced by Will Putney at The Machine Shop (Suicide Silence, Four Year Strong) in New Jersey.  

The album takes the band’s signature death metal foundation, peppered by elements of hardcore and grind but marries it with a groove and swagger previous releases from the band didn’t possess.  Also in full display is technical guitar leads and parts that shred as well as deliver full body breakdowns.

1. City Ov Pyramids

name: TRC- Bright Lights Slipcase CD
description:
SOLD OUT- REPRESSING IN MARCH

1. H.A.T.E.R.S
2. Go Hard Or Go Home
3. Temptation
4. Define Cocky
5. London's Greatest Love Story
6. Closure.
7. Blame It On Vegas
8. Crash Landing
9. The End
10. Wait 'Til It's Finished


TRC stands for 'The Revolution Continues'. With a name that makes such a bold and ambitious statement, you'd be forgiven for thinking that TRC were recruiting for their own private army...though with an album as strong as this one, they will soon have legions on their doorstep.


'Bright Lights' is in equal parts an album made for pit annihilation and for the avid listener. Each spin reveals new twist and turns, and new lyrical gems to either laugh or cry at.
Deftly crafted songs hit with the impact of a sledgehammer. This is pure UK Hardcore - except what sets this record apart from the pack is the lyrical depth from the two pronged vocal attack.

This album captures TRC's terrifying live presence perfectly. You can almost feel the aggression eminating out of the speakers- though where many albums lose their clout from 40 minutes of relentless bludgeoning, 'Bright Lights' does not. Dynamics flow thick and fast, with just the right balance of wry humour ('Define Cocky/Blame It On Vegas') and honesty ('Temptation') to ensure that the band are not lumped in with the meathead hardcore bands who base their whole sound on machismo and breakdowns.

TRC are a one off, never to be imitated or replicated. Fusing pure hostility and aggression via a backbone firmly rooted in Hardcore, the band add their own twist of pure British swagger. 

The Revolution must Continue. TRC are here, and they are about to take over the world.

Recorded 2011 at Broadfield Studios, Hertfordshire by Steve Sears and Thomas Mitchener.

name: Ancient Ascendant- Grim Awakenings
description:
1.	The Scorn Of Dead Men
2.	Once Numb
3.	Bleeding In Exile
4.	Sorrow’s Score
5.	Grim Awakenings
6.	Lost Rage In The Dying Light
7.	Ravenous Undead Of The Dead
8.	Forced Insight
9.	Titan

Ancient Ascendant are a 4 piece death metal band from Reading/London who are pioneering a fusion of old school principles with modern dynamics and power. 

Employing the 3 headed Cerberus of melody, groove and extremity, this unstoppable beast is set to crush all opposition, leaving only a trail of musically satisfied corpses.
After releasing their debut EP “The Heathen Throne” at the end of 2008, Ancient Ascendant received critical acclaim from the UK press, and went on to tour the country with Fleshgod Apocalypse in 2009. 

During this time, the band were honing their style and developing their live show, culminating in 2010 by being handpicked by death metal legends Bolt Thrower to open their sell out London show, their first in 4 years.

Now in 2011 Ancient Ascendant are immensely proud to join forces with Siege of Amida Records to unleash their latest creation upon the world, entitled “The Grim Awakening”. Mixed and mastered at Hertz Studios (Vader, Decapitated) with artwork provided by Tony Koehl (Waking the Cadaver, Black Dahlia Murder), the 9 tracks of old school death metal with a progressive twist are guaranteed to enthral the minds of metal fans looking for a band to pick up where Carcass left off.

name: Diskreet- Engage The Mechanicality
description:
8/10 Metal Hammer
9/10 Legacy
'The Best New Band In Death Metal' - Kerrang!

The anticipated follow up to 2007's 'Infernal Rise' ep, 'Engage The Mechanicality' is the new album from one of the US's most devastating new Death Metal acts. Essential for fans of Origin, Obscura, Nile, Suffocation, Deeds Of Flesh...

1.   Engage(Intro)
2.   Valley Of Kings
3.   Serpents Tongue
4.   Spinal Cord Collection
5.   Bishop of War

name: Ingested- The Surreption
description:
1. Crowning The Abomination
2. Decline
3. The Consequence
4. A Coming Unperceived
5. This Disgusting Revelation
6. Castigation And Rebirth
7. Manifesting Obscenity 
8. 22
9. Kingmaker 
10. The Alpha
11. Omega



Since 2008's 'Surpassing The Boundaries Of Human Suffering' was met with critical acclaim, INGESTED have toured relentlessly with the likes of Dying Fetus, Black Dahlia Murder, Origin, Carnifex, The Faceless, Decrepit Birth; in fact just about everyone. If you haven't witnessed their murderous intent live, then you've been living under a rock.

Manchester's Slam Kings return with 'The Surreption'- a Death Metal record with a magic ingredient....SONGS!
Not just content with ripping your entrails out with a rusty cleaver (which they do perfectly well), Ingested craft songs with instant, groove ridden riffs and hooks. Dare we say we have a CATCHY Death Metal record on our hands? It would appear so....

Featuring guest vocals from Alex Erian (Despised Icon) and Matt Jones (Martyr Defiled), unsettling artwork from Colin Marks (Aborted, Whitechapel), and killer mixing from Mick Kenney (Bleeding Through, Anaal Nathrakh), 'The Surreption' is a savage, bloodthirsty monster of a record and proof of Ingested's maturity as a band both sound wise and lyrically.

So sit back, crank your speakers up and prepare to be slaughtered. Ingested are back, and now they have their eyes set on global domination.

name: Against The Flood- Home Truths
description:
Idle Hands
Left With Us
Upon Red Shores
Sleepless
Turn Towards The Sky
Equators
A Promise In Gold
Roads
Where The Compass Doesn't Lead (Ft. Paul Green of The Arusha Accord)


 South London's finest wrecking crew AGAINST THE FLOOD have been lighting some serious fires in the past six months- with just one self titled digital EP they have secured a legion of followers, a label deal, the backing of The Agency Group for their live booking, strong management and the decimation of stages with the likes of After The Burial, Suicide Silence, Heights, Heart Of A Coward and many more.

Now ATF are back with their debut full length 'Home Truths', which was produced by John Mitchell (Funeral For A Friend, Bleed From Within), and features artwork by Jon Barmby (Devil Sold His Soul, Architects).

Fusing the technicality of Between The Buried And Me, the epic vibe of Underoath and the chugging attack of Misery Signals, topped with an unmistakably British vocal delivery from future pin up Matt Church, Against The Flood have unleashed a monster of a record that will cement them as one of the fastest rising bands in the UK.

Bludgeoning you one minute with 'Upon Red Shores' and soothing you the next with tracks like 'Where The Compass Doesn't Lead', which features soaring guest vocals from The Arusha Accords' Paul Green, 'Home Truths' is a powerfully dynamic record, and a phenomenal statement of intent.

Against The Flood have arrived.

options.name: Against The Flood- Home Truths- Slipcase CD

name: Dripback- Inhaling The Ashes
description:
1. Hold Your Horses
2. Kick Out Time
3. No God, No Master
4. Dilapidated Soul
5. Distrust
6. Under The Floor

Details of an exciting new project featuring members of various underground metal bands have been revealed. Born from a basic desire to have an excuse to hang out more often with close friends, TED MAUL guitarist LUCA GDRAX invited ex band mate, drummer HELLHOG (currently of PURE NEGATIVE), Ex-LABRAT bass wizard ADAM DA RAT, and the toxic duo of RIVER FRESHNEY’s LEE4 (guitars) and WEZ4 (Vocals) to start jamming. After a few months of rehearsals, it soon became apparent that what was being produced deserved more than the confines of a shitty rehearsal space in an industrial estate in West London, and the five set about refining what would become the band’s debut EP, “INHALING THE ASHES”.
Recorded in a 48 hour gap in extreme metal wonder-producer RUSS RUSSELL’s busy schedule before Xmas, the end result is six tracks of some of the freshest sounding hardcore metal this country has produced in recent years. 
Dripping with hate, fiercely brutal, this is metal at its most honest.

"It's so much fun to be thrashing out hardcore metal tunes in the vein of the bands we grew up with” says LUCA, who has been gigging in various bands including AS SHE SCREAMS, INCARCERATED and TED MAUL since 1995. “Entombed, Biohazard, Cro-Mags, just making a stress free environment to get demented and have some fun!" On the upcoming tour, he states: "SOILENT GREEN are kings, we can't wait to share the stage and the bar with those guys. Pure devilry awaits!"
“It feels fucking GREAT to be playing again!” enthuses ADAM DA RAT, who as well as touring the world with LABRAT, also did brief stints standing in for UKHC heroes STAMPIN’ GROUND and NWOAHM champions GOD FORBID, as well as being the original bassplayer in TED MAUL. “It’s so refreshing to be making music for music’s sake” he continues. “There’s no agenda here, no ambition, no ‘Let’s make this our jobs’ type of thinking going on, and I think you can hear that in the tunes. It’s just five guys who love heavy music making a racket with no idea where it will go afterwards. Putting it out on a proper label and going on tour with SOILENT GREEN is not something we aspired to, but it seems everyone that’s heard DRIPBACK wants to help us out and get involved. I am very excited about this.”

The band have posted two tracks for preview at www.dripback.co.uk

Fusing together the brutality of Nile with the Morbid Angel worship seen by the likes of Gojira, their music also incorporates the sprawling, epic soundscapes of bands like Mogwai and Cult Of Luna and a heavy sprinkling of Doom soaked riffs that would please even the most elitist of listeners.

With a lyrical concept focusing around the strength of human potential and mankind's inner potential, the album features a concrete heavy production by Chris Fielding (Dyscarnate, Napalm Death, Electric Wizard), and mastering by Tim Turan (Opeth, Ingested Emperor)

name: Martyr Defiled- Collusion
description:
8/10 Terrorizer
7/10 Metal Hammer
8/10 Powerplay

The eagerly awaited debut album from one of the UK's leading new extreme bands. A must for fans of Behemoth, Decapitated, The Acacia Strain, Meshuggah, All Shall Perish...

Dual artwork CD jewel case with slipcase


1.	Enigma
2.	Maelstrom
3.	An Act Of Sedition
4.	Masochrist
5.	I: Zealot
6.	II: Excommunicate
7.	III: Collusion feat. Jason Evans
8.	The Sectarian State
9.	Archae

name: Glamour Of The Kill- Self Titled EP
description:
The EP that started it all! Huge anthemic choruses and a Metal as fuck attitude from York's finest!

For fans of Avenged Sevenfold, As I Lay Dying, A Day To Remember

1. The Introduction
2. In Search Of Salvation
3. So Who Said Romance Was Dead?
4. Kiss Of Death
5. A Hope In Hell
6. Rise From Your Grave

options.name: Glamour Of The Kill- GOTK - CD

name: The Red Shore- 'Unconsecrated' CD+DVD
description:
Crushing Death Metal from down under. One of the most celebrated DM acts from the Deathcore movement, TRS combine Decapitated/Behemoth style grooves with punishing Morbid Angel riffage and monolithic breakdowns in the vein of All Shall Perish.

Featuring guest vocals from Bleeding Through, Misery Signals, Zao and more.

name: Knights Of The Abyss- Juggernaut
description:
Headbanging Metal from the US for fans of Job For A Cowboy and Hatebreed!

Now on Ferret records- this was the album that started it all...

name: Whitechapel 'The Somatic Defilement'
description:
8/10 Terrorizer
'Whitechapel will take over the world' Metal Hammer

Skullcrushing US Death Metal now taking the scene by storm, for fans of Impaled, Aborted, The Acacia Strain and Suicide Silence...

YOU HEARD THEM HERE FIRST! Grab this critically acclaimed release and see why Knoxville's finest have decimated all.

1. Necrotizing
2. The Somatic Defilement
3. Devirgination Studies
4. Prostatic Fluid Asphyxiation
5. Fairy Fay
6. Ear To Ear
7. Alone In The Morgue
8. Festering Fiesta
9. Vicer Exciser
10. Articulo Mortis

name: Dead Beyond Buried- 'Condemned To Misery' CD
description:
Ultra old school UK Death Metal for fans of Hate Eternal, Deicide and Morbid Angel.

Tracklisting-

1  Bow Down Or Die
2 Condemned To Misery
3 The Aura Of I
4 Until Black Death
5 Dissolution
6 Organic Dementia
7 God Is Dead
8 Spear Of Longinus
9 Innocence Erased
10 Life Slowly Tortured
11 Rape Your Kingdom
12 Dead
13 Skinned And Bled

options.name: dead beyond buried- condemned to misery- cd

name: Diskreet- 'Infernal Rise' EP
description:
THE FIRST EVER SOAR RELEASE!

Face melting US metal for fans of Origin, 'Then You'll Beg' era Cryptopsy and The Faceless. Some of the sickest drumming around!

Look out for their debut album 'Engage The Mechanicality' in the Summer!

Tracklisting-

1  Infernal Throne
2 Infinite Hold
3 The Biggler Complex
4 Entrails
5 Faust
6 The Nightmare
7 Promising Demise
